original_definition: 'internal relevant asset' means a relevant asset which is part of a TSO's control area or a relevant asset located in a distribution system, including a closed distribution system, which is connected directly or indirectly to that TSO's control area;

Article 90: 1.   Each TSO shall coordinate with the DSO the outage planning of internal relevant assets connected to its distribution system.
2.   Each TSO shall coordinate with the CDSO the outage planning of internal relevant assets connected to its closed distribution system.
Article 93: 2.   Each TSO shall carry out the assessment concerning the indicative availability plans for internal relevant assets referred to in paragraph 1 every year until the start of the year-ahead outage coordination.

By 2 years before the start of any year-ahead outage coordination, each TSO shall assess the corresponding indicative availability plans for internal relevant assets, provided by the outage planning agents in accordance with Articles 4, 7 and 15 of Regulation (EU) No 543/2013, and shall provide its preliminary comments including any detected outage planning incompatibilities, to all affected outage planning agents.
